alert.note: Alert for Butler (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 3:58AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Butler and Conecuh. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in a short amount of time. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Evergreen, Georgiana, McKenzie, Castleberry, I65 And US 84, Garland, Mount Olive, Odom Crossroads, Grace, Wilcox, Starlington, Avant, Travis Bridge, Brownville, Chapman, Owassa, Providence, East Chapman and Old Town.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
